page.title: 07Kirmington and Croxton W.I.
page.content: On 3 May 1983 the Kirmington & Croxton Women's Institute was formed by a V.C. O.of Humberside Federation.This first meeting was attended by 22 women. Membership of the Kirmington & Croxton W.I.is open to all women over 16,sub- scription 1985/86 Â£4.In our 3rd year the membership is 18,mostly married women in their 20's or 30's.Approxima- tly half the women living in K. & C. have attended at least one of our meetings since formation less than 3 years ago.We meet on the first Tuesday each month in the village hall.Topics range from Embroidery to First Aid,and Cookery to Local History.Each year we run one evening outing and one open meeting, the latter open to members of the public, men included at no cost. 2 squares of the Domesday project have been done by a group of members in the summer of 1985.This one & Melton Ross.
